com.xtructure.xevolution.genetics
Interface GeneticsObject

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<XIdObject>, EvolutionObject, XIdObject
All Known Subinterfaces:
Genome<D>, NEATGenome<D>, NEATPopulation<D>, Population<D>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGene, AbstractGeneticsObject, AbstractGenome, AbstractLinkGene, AbstractNEATGenome, AbstractNEATPopulation, AbstractNodeGene, AbstractPopulation, ARTLinkGeneImpl, ARTNodeGeneImpl, DummyGene, DummyGeneticsObject, DummyGenome, DummyPopulation, GenomeImpl, LinkGeneImpl, NEATGenomeImpl, NEATPopulationImpl, NodeGeneImpl, PopulationImpl
public interface GeneticsObject
extends XIdObject, EvolutionObject

Interface for entities or collections of entities involved in evolution (e.g., Genomes and Population). They all have ids and base ids. The latter should be common among all EvolutionObjects of the same type. For example, all GenomeImpls have the base id "Genome", though different instances may have ids "Genome:[1]" and "Genome:[2]". Also, EvolutionObject's have a set of attributes, which may be used to hold statistics, measurements, or any kind of observation, so long as it's represented with a Comparable value.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda
